item.title: TeamCity Pipelines Is Now Out of Beta
item.description: In March 2024, we announced the Beta release of TeamCity Pipelines, a new approach to CI/CD that offers blazing-fast pipelines to optimize your development flow. item.title: The Evolution of the Kotlin Language and How You Can Contribute
item.description: Kotlin‚Äôs evolution is significantly influenced by its active community. From early ideas to the final features, it‚Äôs shaped by feedback, discussions, and real-world use cases. We call this process KEEP ‚Äì the Kotlin Evolution and Enhancement Process. To keep you informed about what‚Äôs coming next, we‚Äôve created the new Kotlin Language Features and Proposals page. item.title: Complete the Un-Completable: The State of AI Completion in JetBrains IDEs
item.description: Code completion has always been a standout feature in JetBrains IDEs, helping developers code faster, smarter, and with fewer mistakes. But what if it could do even more? What if it could predict not just the next element but entire lines of code ‚Äì or even complete blocks? That‚Äôs exactly what we‚Äôve been working on. item.title: Support for SLNX Solution Files
item.description: For nearly twenty years, the .NET community has enjoyed working with solution files (*.sln). Due to their tooling-centered format, manually changing these files has always been challenging. Merge conflicts in solution files‚Äîmuch like merging CSPROJ files‚Äîwere commonplace and often resulted in corrupted files or lost changes. The structure of SLN files is overly verbose‚Äîan empty [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2024/10/04/support-for-slnx-solution-files/
